nodes.label: Unified Plant Theory
nodes.description: A unified theory of plant photosynthesis and hydraulics based on trait-based optimality.

nodes.label: Plant Hydraulics
nodes.description: Concerns the transport of water and risks of hydraulic failure.

nodes.label: Photosynthesis
nodes.description: Process of converting light energy into chemical energy, involving CO2 uptake and biochemical processes.

nodes.label: Optimization Principle
nodes.description: Plants optimize stomatal conductance and photosynthetic capacity to maximize net carbon gain (profit).

nodes.label: Hydraulic Pathway
nodes.description: The continuous column of water from soil, through roots, stem (xylem), and to the leaves.

nodes.label: Water Potential Gradient (Δψ)
nodes.description: The driving force for water movement from soil to leaf.

nodes.label: Stomatal Conductance (gs)
nodes.description: Controls the rates of transpiration and CO2 uptake through stomata.

nodes.label: Transpiration (E)
nodes.description: Water loss from the plant to the atmosphere, driven by vapor pressure deficit (D).

nodes.label: Hydraulic Failure Risk
nodes.description: Risk of embolism in xylem due to excessively negative water potentials, leading to mortality.

nodes.label: Photosynthetic Capacity
nodes.description: The maximum rate at which the leaf can carry out photosynthesis.

nodes.label: CO2 Assimilation (A)
nodes.description: The process of fixing atmospheric CO2 into organic compounds.

nodes.label: Photosynthetic Coordination
nodes.description: Carboxylation-limited (Ac) and light-limited (Aj) assimilation rates are coordinated (Ac = Aj).

nodes.label: Profit Maximization (F)
nodes.description: Maximizing net carbon gain after accounting for costs.

nodes.label: Photosynthetic Costs
nodes.description: Costs of maintaining carboxylation and electron transport capacities.

nodes.label: Hydraulic Costs
nodes.description: Costs of building/maintaining hydraulic pathways and risk of failure.

edges.label: enables
edges.description: The pathway's conductance (Kp) and vulnerability (ψ50) determine the potential gradient.

edges.label: regulates
edges.description: Plants adjust gs to manage Δψ and avoid hydraulic risk.

edges.label: controls
edges.description: E = 1.6 * gs * D. Governs water loss.

edges.label: controls
edges.description: Governs CO2 uptake, creating a fundamental trade-off.

edges.label: increases
edges.description: High transpiration leads to more negative water potentials.

edges.label: limits
edges.description: Vcmax and Jmax set the upper bound for the assimilation rate A.

edges.label: maximizes
edges.description: The benefit term in the profit function is the carbon gain A.

edges.label: represents_cost_of
edges.description: Costs increase quadratically with the stress (Δψ) on the hydraulic system.
